pull.title: test: Add Wallet Unlock Context Manager
pull.body:
Fixes #28601, see https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28403#discussion_r1325426430

Add Context Manager to manage the locking and unlocking of locked wallets with a passphrase during testing.

events.body:

I think there is one more that can be using the context:

```
test/functional/wallet_fundrawtransaction.py:        wallet.walletpassphrase("test", 999000)

events.message:
test: Add Wallet Unlock Context Manager

Add Context Manager to manage wallet locking/unlocking with passphrase

events.body: @maflcko could you please review the changes

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -122,3 +122,21 @@ def generate_keypair(compressed=True, wif=False):
     if wif:
         privkey = bytes_to_wif(privkey.get_bytes(), compressed)
     return privkey, pubkey
+
+class WalletUnlockContextManager():
comments.body:
```suggestion
class WalletUnlock():
```

nit: I don't think other context managers have it in their name, so could remove this as well, but no strong opinion, either is fine.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -122,3 +122,21 @@ def generate_keypair(compressed=True, wif=False):
     if wif:
         privkey = bytes_to_wif(privkey.get_bytes(), compressed)
     return privkey, pubkey
+
+class WalletUnlockContextManager():
+    """
+    A context manager for unlocking a wallet with a passphrase and automatically locking it afterward.
+    """
+
+    TIMEOUT = 999000 # WALLET_PASSPHRASE_TIMEOUT
comments.body:
What does the comment mean?

nit: Could use the maximum allowed value?
